sentence.Network_en: United States Steel remained the citadel of anti - unionism in the mass industries until 1937.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到1937年,美国钢铁公司仍然是大规模工业中反对工会的堡垒.

sentence.Network_en: More important, employers somewhat frantically organized company unions as a foil to independent unionism.
sentence.Network_cn: 更主要的是, 雇主们多少有些疯狂地组织公司工会,作为独立工会制度的陪衬.

sentence.Network_en: The strike is the ultima ratio of Trade Unionism.
sentence.Network_cn: 罢工是工联主义的最后手段.

entry.def: Unionism is any set of political principles based on the idea that two or more political or national units should be joined or remain together, for example that Northern Ireland should remain part of the United Kingdom.
Unionism is the same as trade unionism .
